newsitem.title: GERMANY: Goldman downgrades Allianz to neutral.
newsitem.headline: Goldman downgrades Allianz to neutral.

text.p: Goldman Sachs, the U.S. investment bank, said on Tuesday it lowered its rating on German insurance group Allianz AG Holding to neutral from outperformer.
A bank spokesman confirmed the rating change but declined to comment further.
But market sources said Goldman downgraded Allianz because it lowered earnings per share estimates for the year and shares in the insurance group have risen so strongly since January.
Allianz shares, which were trading at about 280 marks at the start of the year, on Tuesday were up 3.90 marks at 365.50 marks in pre-bourse IBIS electronic dealings.
